alert.note: Alert for Elliott; Menifee; Morgan; Rowan; Wolfe (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 04 at 5:54AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 915 AM EDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of east central Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in east central Kentucky, Elliott, Menifee and Rowan. In southeast Kentucky, Morgan and Wolfe. * WHEN...Until 915 AM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 553 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1 and 2.0 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Morehead, West Liberty, Sandy Hook, Henry, Wellington, Zag, Dehart, Yocum, Kellacey, Twentysix, Blaze, Leisure, Paragon, Omer, Woodsbend, Ebon, Pomp, Craney, Licking River and Wrigley.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
